item.title: cucumber and testcontainers
item.description: I recently wrote an integration test framework for a Kafka pipeline using Cucumber and Testcontainers. This is part 2 of a series explaining how, in which we’ll start Kafka using the Testcontainers library. Part 1 is here if you want to see how to set up Cucumber to run tests from Maven & your IDE. what is testcontainers? I’ll cover Testcontainers more fully in a separate post some time but, for now, we just need to know that Testcontainers is a rather amazing library for starting infrastructure such as databases or messaging systems in Docker containers at test-time.

item.title: cucumber set up
item.description: I recently wrote an integration test framework for a Kafka pipeline using Cucumber and Testcontainers. This is part 1 of a series explaining how, starting with setting up our project to be able to run Cucumber tests from maven & our IDE (IntelliJ in my case). why cucumber? I’d previously written a couple of integration test frameworks triggered from JUnit @Test methods. These both used fluent APIs to set up the required environment & execute the test, hiding the plumbing from the test author.
